programmes.show_description: Many European colonies vied for dominance and cultural supremacy in Bengal. As a result, its cuisine imbibed many Western influences.
Genevieve's adventures in Costa Rica begin in the capital city, San Jose, where she checks off some Costa Rican rites of passage.
From the Perperikon fort to the Sofia Central Market, Catriona explores the cultural treasures of Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.
Roshni's journey gets off to a rocky start in Jairampur when everything goes wrong.
Jamie Srubis tries some of the signature spa treatments of the Shangri La Resort at Kota Kinabalu in Sabah, Malaysia.
On a tour to see Plovdiv's ancient monuments and ruins, Catriona realizes why the city is called the 'Eternal City' of Bulgaria.
Alex meets some veteran sweet shop owners in Kolkata, who teach her to prepare forgotten Bengali sweets.
Guided by her love for coffee, Genevieve ventures into the heart of Heredia, a lush coffee-growing region.
Exploring Brussels makes Catriona realize that it's the city where historic meets hip, eccentric meets futuristic and traditional meets cosmopolitan.
A striking golden Buddhist shrine in Namsai draws Roshni to it. She learns the secret behind the peaceful lives led by the monks here.
Robbie's journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes.
On visiting the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, Catriona sees that there is much more to Sunny beach than meets the eye.
Called 'khad maas', game meat in Rajasthan used to be slow-cooked in underground pits by soldiers to ensure that enemy troops didn't see any fire.
In the heart of Costa Rica's countryside, Genevieve embarks on a journey of cultural immersion in Chilamate.
From the stories of famous Egyptian pharaohs to Greco-Roman beliefs, the ancient temples of Egypt contain mysteries waiting to unfold.
On a visit to Hawai, the land of the Mishmi tribe, Roshni stays with some members of the tribe, who treat her to a rather potent local brew.
Robbie's adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle.
From Perperikon Fort to Boyana church, the monuments of Sofia are portals to different periods of its rich history.
Alex discovers the ingenuity and artistry of Rajasthani cuisine, as she learns to make a traditional meat preparation, which uses meat leftovers.
Costa Rica is home to nearly 30 national parks, and Genevieve sets out to explore one of them, Rincón de la Vieja.
From soothing landscapes to relaxing massages, Indeya Passfield explores all that Kandy has to offer in terms of rejuvenation.
In Roing, Roshni visits the local market and tries an infamous chilli that has reduced seasoned foodies to tears.
Holiday Inspiration. Discover the perfect holiday for you, featuring the hottest destinations and exclusive deals to make your next holiday the best one.
From the magnificent Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque to the enchanting Muttrah Souq, Elisha experiences the classic Arabic charms of Oman, in Muscat.
After finding his grandparents' handwritten recipes, Vikramaditya Sodawas, the owner of Karni Fort, decided to revive his family's prized recipes.
Genevieve is drawn to Costa Rica's stunning Guanacaste region by its promise of thrilling water adventures.
The host visits Dubai's very own tropical rainforest and a wildlife sanctuary that is home to wild flamingos.
Attending a tea festival in Pasighat gives Roshni the chance to savour some of the most premium varieties of tea produced in Arunachal Pradesh.
The home of a great night's sleep. Every body. Every bedroom. Every budget.
From the limestone formations of Wadi Bani Khaled to the ocean of dunes at Wahiba Sands, Elisha gets a taste of Oman's natural heritage.
Alex visits Karni Fort and Fort Begu in Rajasthan, where she unearths some prized dishes of the nobilities.
Venturing deep into Puntarenas, Genevieve seeks an adrenaline rush in the lush embrace of Monteverde.
On her travels across Cambodia, Sukhmani is lost in the wonders of Angkor, the archaeological park that transports her to the era of the Khmer empire.
From paragliding to ziplining, the adventures Roshni has in Mechuka give her an intense adrenaline rush.
In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie's journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.
Apart from deserts, Oman also has majestic, rust-colored mountain ranges, which quietly hold the country's history in them.
Sukhmani is on a break in Cambodia, where she gets to stay at a resort, which used to be the royal guest house.
Genevieve visits the charming town of Zarcero, where she chances upon the prized cheese of Costa Rica.
Atlanta announces itself with force confident, expressive, and always in motion.
The grand finale of Robbie's wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.
Travel show highlighting places to go, the history of Britain, cookery and news.
Hungry for stories and flavours of a bygone kingdom, Alex meets Rana Sawai Harisingh II, the 24th descendant to the royal family of Begu.
Sukhmani is on a break in Cambodia, where she gets to stay at a resort, which used to be the royal guest house.
Genevieve visits the charming town of Zarcero, where she chances upon the prized cheese of Costa Rica.
Atlanta announces itself with force confident, expressive, and always in motion.
The grand finale of Robbie's wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.
The renowned American novelist and writer Mark twain after traveling on this train wrote .... "It is the most enjoyable day I have spent on earth.
Ha Long Bay in Vietnam, a spectacular emerald expanse of water with nearly 2000 islands, is a treasure trove of history, legends, culture and scenery.
Hungry for stories and flavours of a bygone kingdom, Alex meets Rana Sawai Harisingh II, the 24th descendant to the royal family of Begu.
In Arequipa, Milagros has set out to peel back the layers of her country's history.
Alex meets Anjali Singh, a member of the royal family of Jaipur, who introduces her to two prized dishes of the city's culinary heritage.
Through sights such as the Seaplane Harbour Museum and Telliskivi Cretive City, Marco and Erica discover the offbeat side to Tallinn.
From Antoni Gaudi's whims to hosting the 1992 Olympics, Alex finds out that Barcelona has been shaped by many different things.
At the Safari World in Thailand, Elisha has the experience of a lifetime when a tiger baby snuggles into her arm and she gets a chance to feed him.
Charlie's journey across his homeland brings him to the birthplace of tequila, the iconic Mexican spirit to understand what makes it irresistible.
Amidst the sapphire expanse of Lake Titicaca, Milagros embarks on a journey of reconnecting with her roots.
In Bihar's countryside, Alex gets acquainted with the earthy cuisine that fuels farmers to toil in the fields all day.
Marco and Erica learn about Estonia's troubled past while exploring Narva, the city at its easternmost limit.
From visiting the Baroque style Royal Palace to relishing churros at Chocolateria San Gines, Alex enjoys the city's liveliness wherever she goes.
How would you react if you saw a man who has scorpions all over his face? Elisha finds herself face to face with one at Koh Samui in Thailand.
From the towering Peña de Bernal monolith to the Queretaro wine region, Charlie visits some of Mexico's lesser-known cultural gems.
Milagros visits the ancient city of Cusco just in time for the legendary Inti Raymi Festival, a gateway to the Inca empire's beliefs.
Eisha meets the renowned chef, Sudip Pai, who introduces her to the largely unexplored cuisine of one of India's oldest communities.
Marco and Erica explore the vitality and eccentricities of Tartu. They also get acquainted with the distinct ways of the Seto community.
The stupendous architecture of Portugal's monuments reveals the various stages of the country's evolution.
While boating in the emerald waters of the Phang Nga Bay, Elisha has an out-of-the-world experience when she chances upon secret lagoons and caves.
Charlie Rubio visits one of the many 'indigenous paradises' across Mexico, where he gets a chance to visit a hidden heron sanctuary on an island.
Scaling rocks and defying heights, Milagros finds herself suspended 1200 feet above the ground at the Sacred Valley of the Incas.
Renowned food blogger and caterer, Mehnaz Mansud introduces Eisha to some forgotten recipes of Parsi cuisine.
Marco and Erica find out about Estonia's "fifth season" as they try bog walking and camping at Soomaa National Park.
From fishing and boat rides to cinnamon harvesting, Indeya Passfield indulges in the local ways of life in Bentota.
The home of a great night's sleep. Every body. Every bedroom. Every budget.
In Monterrey, one of Mexico's 'Pueblo Magicos', Charlie heads straight to a canyon, where the locals go to have 'beer and barbecue' picnics.
Embarking on a homecoming adventure in the heart of the Peruvian Amazonas, Milagros explores her roots like never before.
A blend of Bhutan's Dzong architecture and modern design and enhanced with classical hand-drawn Buddhist murals, Taj Tashi lies in the midst of tall mountains and lush landscapes of Thimphu.
The Roys' dreamy Maldives return takes an unexpected turn when Manasi's first scuba dive plunges their perfect getaway into uncharted emotional waters
Indeya, in this episode unwinds in Sri Lanka at a nature resort. Here she visits a 2200-year-old Buddhist temple, later tries bodyboarding and explores the Yala National Park and its surroundings.
Holiday Inspiration. Discover the perfect holiday for you, featuring the hottest destinations and exclusive deals to make your next holiday the best one.
What began as an adventurous getaway in Santiago unexpectedly transforms into a spiritually moving experience for Charlie!
As Milagros delves deeper into the heart of the Amazonas, her journey takes a thrilling turn.
In Vienna, Jolly chances upon a Baroque palace that houses mysteries of not only the world in which we live but also of the heavens above.
The Roys' Maldives adventure tests more than their limits - can love navigate the currents of conflicting desires?
Jamie Srubis tries many different spa treatments, which leave her skin glowing, at the Movenpick Resort in Jordan.
Aradhana discovers the historical treasures of Tel Aviv at Neve Tzedek, the first Jewish neighborhood outside of the old port city of Jaffa.
In Cuatro Ciénegas, Charlie finds himself uncovering the wonders of the destination, one more surreal than the other.
On the map of Mexico, Tlaquepaque looks like just another suburb of Guadalajara, but Charlie knows that there is more to this town than meets the eye.
Milagros's first stop to showcase her country is at Ica on Peru's southern coast known for its vineyards and for the desert oasis, Huacachina.
Away from urgency, North Georgia reveals its quiet authority.
Marco Biagioli and Erica Melargo experience the fairy-tale charms of the medieval Old Town of Tallinn, the capital of Estonia.
The mystical Emerald Buddha in Bangkok's Grand Palace travelled across many countries for hundreds of years before settling down in Thailand.
On a trip to Rajasthan, Alex meets Ajayraj Singh, a blue-blooded dignitary, who introduces her to the secret meat dishes of the kingdom of Mewar.

Milagros's first stop to showcase her country is at Ica on Peru's southern coast known for its vineyards and for the desert oasis, Huacachina.

Marco Biagioli and Erica Melargo experience the fairy-tale charms of the medieval Old Town of Tallinn, the capital of Estonia.
The mystical Emerald Buddha in Bangkok's Grand Palace travelled across many countries for hundreds of years before settling down in Thailand.
